meanings.definition: A highly contagious viral disease characterized by fever and a distinctive rash.
meanings.sent1: The variola spread quickly through the village, causing many people to fall ill.
meanings.sent2: Doctors worked tirelessly to contain the variola outbreak in the community.
meanings.sent3: The variola virus decided to take a vacation and visit a new town, spreading its unique rash everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The variola outbreak was like a wildfire, spreading rapidly and affecting everyone in its path.
meanings.sent5: The variola disease left a trail of red spots and high fevers wherever it went.

meanings.sent1: Scientists studied the variola under microscopes to understand its structure.
meanings.sent2: Health officials worked hard to eradicate the variola virus from the population.
meanings.sent3: The variola virus threw a party inside the human body, inviting all its viral friends.
meanings.sent4: The variola virus was like a tiny invader, causing chaos within the cells.
meanings.sent5: The variola virus was a sneaky intruder, silently infecting its hosts.
